description.p: This select extends the assignments of an organization or a person in an organization to Product.

A Product is something an organisation has identified for some purpose. A product is uniquely identified by an identifier and an organisational scope of that identifier within a type of product. This is required since an organization may produce many types of products.

example.p: An organization may have two products numbered 2865000 where one is a drawing or document and the other is a part.

description.p: A product belongs to one or more categories and has one or more versions.

note.p: The mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of organisation id is outside the scope of ISO 10303.

explicit.name: id
explicit.description: the identification of the product assigned by the organisation

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: words by which the product is known.

explicit.name: categories
explicit.description: the class or classes with hierarchies to which the product belongs.

inverse.name: identifier
inverse.description: the organisation (or person in an organisation) that assigned and owns the product id

unique.label: UR1
unique.description: The combination of the id, identifier, and product_type shall be unique.

where.label: WR1
where.description: The identifier role shall be 'id owner'.

where.label: WR2
where.description: The product_type role shall be 'part', 'raw material', 'document', 'functionality', or 'requirement'.

where.label: document
where.description: The item plays the role of a document.

where.label: part
where.description: The item plays the role of a part.

where.label: functionality
where.description: The item plays the role of a function.

where.label: raw material
where.description: The item plays the role of raw material.

where.label: requirement
where.description: The item plays the role of a requirement.
